channel.title: My first model
channel.description:
OK i really don't have any clue what im doing with models but it looked cool so i thought i would give it a go, this is all prims and its a shotgun, and yes i know it sucks so don't tell me it sucks haha. Pleas give constructive criticism and tell me how i can improve. Im going to make a sword next following a prim sword tut i read like a month ago.
[IMG]http://i1038.photobucket.com/albums/a468/cjdean1/modeling/shotgun.jpg[/img]

item.title: My first model
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

This is not that bad at all mate, congratulations on making this.

Read full topic

item.title: My first model
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:2, topic:373661”]CONGRATS!!! You’re now better than 50% of this board!!
You’re probably saying to yourself “Why is this, reyx7? Are you being a sarcastic asshole?”
The answer to that my friend, is no!! You have successfully made a 3d item, and with primitives!! It’s not a skillcape, a recolored whip, or a traced sword of shit!!
Again, Congratz!![/quote]

Put simply, +9001

Read full topic

item.title: My first model
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

OK:) i will do thanks for the link, but first check out this sword i am working on, and for my seond time making a model i’d say it’s pretty damn good.

i still need to make the hilt and find some cool way that the blade attaches to that circle thing, lol wow i feel retarded i don’t know shapes atm sorry im just in a huge rush to get this done i feel accomplished right now :D, but yea i need to make a cool hilt and attach the blade somehow and color it, witch idk how to do.

Read full topic

item.title: My first model
item.dc:creator: @Timberpig1 Timberpig.
item.description:
@Timberpig1 wrote:

after my own heart rexy;)

Read full topic

item.title: My first model
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

This is very nice, if you plan to keep modeling please have a look at my video. It will show you the main tools you will need to creating good primitive models. I know the model in the video is not the best, but it looks decent for teaching purposes.

Read full topic
